alert.note: Alert for Towner (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 22 at 11:44AM CST until December 24 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST SATURDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, blowing snow expected. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Towner County. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until noon CST Saturday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 9 PM this evening to 6 PM CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Areas of blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and/or evening commutes and holiday travel. The dangerously cold wind chills will cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. If outside, make sure you wear appropriate winter clothing. Use caution while traveling, especially in open areas. The latest road conditions for North Dakota can be found at dot.nd.gov/travel and for Minnesota at 511mn.org, or by calling 5 1 1 in either state.
